topic.title: The Contextual Menu of the Outline View

keywords.indexterm: XML Outline Viewdocument structure changecontextual menu

body.p: The following actions are available from the contextual menu of the Outline view:

Edit Attributes... Allows you to edit all the attributes of a selected node. You can find more details about this action in the topic.
The Append Child..., Insert Before... and Insert After... submenus of the contextual menu in the Outline view allow you to quickly insert new tags into the document at the location of the currently selected element. When you select any of these three submenus, a content completion window is invoked that offers a list of elements that can be inserted.

dlentry.dd: Invokes a content completion list with the names of all the elements that are allowed by the associated schema and inserts your selection as a child of the current element.
Invokes a content completion list with the names of all the elements that are allowed by the associated schema and inserts your selection immediately before the current element as a sibling.
Invokes a content completion list with the names of all the elements that are allowed by the associated schema and inserts your selection immediately after the current element as a sibling.

body.p: The Toggle comment item of the outline tree popup menu is the same item as in the editor popup menu with the same name. It encloses the currently selected element of the outline tree in an XML comment, if the element is not commented, or uncomments it, if it is commented.

The Cut, Copy and Paste items of the popup menu execute the same actions as the Edit menu items with the same name on the currently selected elements.The Cut, Copy, Paste, and Delete actions are the same actions as the Edit menu actions with the same name on the currently selected elements.
